page.title: 19ANIMALS IN LAYER MARNEY
page.content: At Thoringtons Farm, Layer Marney we saw a dairy herd of Friesian cows. Their calves are fattened for beef if they are bullocks, or put back into the herd if they are heifers. Milk quotas have meant that the size of the herd has been reduced from 80 cows to only 40. Sheep have been introduced in the last year because of the milk quotas. Pigs are kept at Park House Farm, but not by the owner. They are housed in a barn and fattened for the market. At Rockinghams Farm we saw spaniel puppies. These are sold as potential gun dogs. There are labrador dogs at Roundbush Farm which are used as gun dogs. One of the four horses kept at Thorringtons Farm is used to pull a trap made by Mr K Coe using a traditional design; he sometimes makes these for other people.
